intro: Amoria suffocata, commonly known as the suffocated amoria, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories where it can thrive without direct sunlight. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Amoria suffocata is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
